pullRequest.body:
This PR defines the categorical notion of `2`-exact square in the sense of Guitart. It is introduced in order to prepare for future applications to derived functors.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7894619004/job/21545603170)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7894619004/job/21545602800)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7894619004/job/21545603019)
Is there a reason to include `J` in the names, beyond the fact that `J` was used in the paper you cite?
I have renamed this one as `StructuredArrowRightwards` and the other one as `CostructuredArrowDownwards`.

Please spell out at least one of these conditions/characterizations. Also, maybe provide a bit of motivation for this notion (as I think it isn't that well-known), or maybe provide a pointer to more info.

I guess this is a typo?
```suggestion
@Article{         Guitart1980,
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): Guitart exact squares

source.title: feat/refactor: redefinition of homology + derived categories
